properties.areaDesc: Western Klamath National Forest; Central Siskiyou County Including Shasta Valley
properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 8 at 10:46PM PDT until August 9 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and
critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread
potential of any new and existing fires.

* Affected area:
Eastern Fire Weather Zone 280, including the Scott Valley and
sections of the McKinney Fire over higher terrain, Fort Jones,
Etna, and Greenview. This does not include the Yeti Fire.

Fire Weather Zone 281, including the Shasta Valley and sections
of the McKinney Fire over higher terrain. This includes Yreka,
Hilt, Weed, Grenada and Montague.

* Wind: South winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 45 mph Tuesday
afternoon and evening.

* Humidity: 5 to 15 percent.

* Additional Details: The strongest winds will occur within the
Shasta Valley around Weed and over higher terrain.
properties.instruction:
Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot
vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause
sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions
at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less
wildfire.

Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don't
want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit
for more information.

Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go?
How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your
are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information.

A Red Flag Warning does not mean there is a fire. It means that
critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will
shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may
become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire
threatens.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 281 AND 280... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 281 AND 280

properties.areaDesc: Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta; Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley; Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest; South Central Oregon Desert including the BLM Land in Eastern Lake and Western Harney Counties
properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 8 at 10:46PM PDT until August 9 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* Impacts: Lightning and very dry vegetation will likely result in
new fire starts. Gusty thunderstorm winds could contribute to
fire spread. Despite rainfall, initial attack resources could be
overwhelmed and holdover fires are possible. In western portions
of zone 284, strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and
critically dry vegetation could also greatly increase the spread
potential of any new and existing fires Tuesday afternoon and
evening.

* Affected area:
In Northern CA Fire Zones...284...285.
In South Central OR Fire Zones...624...625.

* Wind: South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. Near
thunderstorms, quickly shifting winds to 50 mph are possible.

* Thunderstorms: Thunderstorms will increase through this evening.
Activity could linger tonight and into Tuesday, shifting east
and north with time. Storms will also become wetter by Tuesday.

* Humidity: as low as 10 percent in western parts of zone 284.

* View the hazard area in detail at:
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT TUESDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND 624 AND 625 IN OREGON

properties.areaDesc: Surprise Valley California; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Mono; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Northern Washoe County
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 8 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* Scattered showers with a few embedded thunderstorms will be
possible overnight. With remnant cloud cover over the region, it
will be a slower start for thunderstorms on Tuesday as compared
to Monday.

* We still anticipate thunderstorms to develop Tuesday afternoon
and evening, primarily near and east of US-395. There is a 25
to 50 percent chance of any one point seeing a storm in this
area, with a 10 percent chance for areas to the west.

* Another round of heavy rains from these storms is possible with
simulations indicating the potential for 1-2 inches per hour
from any storms that develop. This would result in renewed
flash flooding threats, especially on recent burn scars such as
the Tamarack, Caldor, and Dixie.

* People living in flood prone areas or near these recent burn
scars should monitor the forecast and be prepared to take action
should heavy rains occur or a flash flood warning be issued.

NWSheadline: Showers Tonight, more Thunderstorms with a Heavy Rain Risk Tuesday

properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued August 8 at 2:16PM PDT until August 10 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph
expected.

* WHERE...Interstate 5, south of Yreka, and the cities of
Montague, Grenada Gazelle and Weed.

* WHEN...From 1 PM Tuesday to 5 AM PDT Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...winds are expected to be strongest near
Weed.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY

properties.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 8 at 12:21PM PDT by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
The North Coast Unified Air Quality Management District has issued
an Air Quality Alert for Burnt Ranch, Salyer, and Hawkins Bar in
effect until noon PDT Tuesday.

An alert indicates hazardous conditions for all groups. All people
should limit the amount of time they spend outdoors for any reason.
For more information, check the NCUAQD website.

FOR PERSONS IN DEL NORTE...HUMBOLDT AND TRINITY COUNTIES...Please
visit the North Coast Unified Air Quality Management District
website at www.ncuaqd.org to access the current air quality alert.

NWSheadline: AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TUESDAY FOR BURNT RANCH, SALYER, AND HAWKINS BAR
